sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Illinois Waterway Act.

sections.heading: A deep waterway shall be constructed from the
sections.text:
water power plant of the Sanitary District of Chicago, at or near Lockport,
in the township of Lockport, in the County of Will, to a point in the
Illinois River at or near Utica. Such waterway shall be known as "The
Illinois Waterway."

sections.heading: The terms used in this Act shall be construed as follows:
sections.text: The terms used in this Act shall be construed as follows:

sections.heading: The construction, maintenance, control and operation of "The
sections.text:
Illinois Waterway" and its appurtenances shall devolve upon the Department
of Natural Resources.

sections.heading: Subject to the conditions and limitations prescribed by this Act,
sections.text:
and subject to any conditions and limitations which the Federal government
or the officers thereof may lawfully impose, the Department of
Natural Resources shall have the power stated in
Sections 7.1 to 7.16, inclusive, of this Act.

sections.heading: To prepare plans and specifications for the construction of "The
sections.text: Illinois Waterway" and its appurtenances.

sections.heading: To construct, control, manage, maintain and operate such waterway
sections.text: and its appurtenances.

sections.heading: To use or to lease, or permit the use of,
sections.text:
in whole or in part, the surplus waters of
such waterway, for a period not to exceed 50 years, and to sell, use, lease
or permit the use of, in whole or in part, any land, rights in land or property
interests for hydropower development,
or the power developed therefrom, for a period not to exceed 50 years.

sections.heading: To construct, maintain and operate power plants, structures,
sections.text:
buildings and appliances relative thereto for the utilization of the
surplus waters arising from the construction, maintenance or operation of
the waterway, and to lease, sell or otherwise dispose of the whole or any
part of the electrical current or energy thereby generated.

sections.heading: To establish and collect reasonable rates of toll for the passage
sections.text:
through and the use of such waterway, dams, locks, and other appurtenances
within the limits of the State, but such waterway and its appurtenances
shall be free for the transportation of any property of the United States
or persons in the service thereof passing through the same.

sections.heading: To prescribe reasonable rules and regulations in respect to all
sections.text:
matters connected with the navigation and use of such waterway and its
appurtenances.

sections.heading: To acquire by donation, purchase, contract or exchange any
sections.text:
property, real or personal, necessary or incident to the construction,
maintenance, equipment, operation or repair of the waterway and its
appurtenances.

sections.heading: To acquire by condemnation under the eminent domain laws of this
sections.text:
State all property necessary to be taken or damaged for the construction,
maintenance, operation or repair of such waterway and its appurtenances.

sections.heading: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act
sections.text: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act.

sections.heading: To enter upon and use any lands, waters, stream and materials of
sections.text:
any description, necessary for the prosecution of the works contemplated by
this Act.

sections.heading: To repair, replace or reconstruct any and all public bridges
sections.text:
along the line of such waterway in order to provide safe and suitable
navigation along such waterway, and to require the removal or alteration of
bridges owned, controlled or operated by private corporations or persons
which hinder or obstruct navigation.

sections.heading: To sell and dispose of any machinery, tools, fixtures, stone,
sections.text:
debris, material or personal property unnecessary for the proper
management, construction, repair or use of the waterway or its
appurtenances.

sections.heading: To sell or to lease, from time to time, any of the lands or lots
sections.text:
acquired for use in the construction of such waterway, or in the
development of power incident thereto and no longer needed for the
maintenance, use and operation of such waterway or water power.

sections.heading: To grant the right or privilege to any public utility or
sections.text:
municipality to use any tunnel constructed as an appurtenance of the
Illinois Waterway for the purpose of placing, operating and maintaining
therein conduits, cables, gas mains, water mains and other equipment
required in connection therewith upon such terms as may be agreed upon
between the Department of Natural Resources and such public utility or
municipality.

sections.heading: To obtain, subject to the provisions of the "Personnel Code",
sections.text:
approved July 18, 1955, as heretofore or hereafter amended, as many
engineers, draftsmen, surveyors, agents, clerks, superintending or expert
help, laborers and other persons as may be necessary to the designing and
construction of the waterway and its appurtenances.

sections.heading: To make application to the Federal Government for all necessary  permits.
sections.text: To make application to the Federal Government for all necessary permits.

sections.heading: To make all contracts and to do all acts necessary to carry into
sections.text: effect the powers herein granted.

sections.heading: In the construction of such waterway through the City of Joliet,
sections.text:
the elevation of the water surface at normal stage shall not be higher at
Granite Street than minus 40.5 Chicago
city
datum, and in the event that the shoal reach between the upper basin of the
Illinois and Michigan Canal and the crossing of the Elgin, Joliet and
Eastern Railway is deepened 2 feet or more, then the
elevation of the
water surface at normal stage shall not be higher at Granite Street than
minus 41 Chicago city datum, and the channel through said
city shall
not be less than 270 feet in width between
Spring
Street on the north and Lafayette Street on the south. Any dams constructed
in connection with and for the maintenance of this pool of water shall be
of such design as to quickly dispose of all flood waters. Adequate
intercepting sewers shall be constructed of sufficient size and at such
depth as will provide outlets not only for the present sewers that may be
interfered with by the construction of such waterway, but also of
sufficient size and depth to take care of all the watershed tributary to
the Des Plaines River that may be interfered with by
changing the water
levels through the City of Joliet. The Department of Natural Resources is
authorized to utilize such riparian rights of the Sanitary District of
Chicago in, through and near the City of Joliet and along the Des Plaines
River in the County of Will as, in its judgment, may be found necessary for
the construction, maintenance and operation of such waterway, or for the
development of water power in connection therewith, and the Department of
Natural Resources shall not be required to make compensation to such Sanitary
District for the right so utilized, except that the Department of
Natural Resources shall reimburse such Sanitary District for any expense to
which it may be put as a result of such act of the Department of
Natural Resources in the maintenance and operation of such Sanitary District
channel. The Sanitary District of Chicago shall not be deprived of access
to such waterway over any walls or embankments constructed, or of the
enjoyment of dockage rights in connection with any property it has acquired
or owns, subject only to the use of such property by the Department of
Natural Resources for waterway and power purposes.

sections.heading: If any section, subdivision, sentence or clause in this Act shall
sections.text:
be held to be invalid, the invalidity thereof shall not affect the
remaining parts of this Act.
